main event: In 1955, a civilian sighting in Manden, North Dakota reported a glowing object that fell from the sky, suspected to be a meteor.
interesting points: The sighting lasted only four seconds but was described as a bright glowing object that reached the ground., A metal fragment measuring 3/4 inch was found the next day by the observer's husband., The object's composition was determined to be predominantly aluminum and iron., The sighting was classified as highly ordinary despite the unusual appearance of the object., The witness described the object as glowing, similar to a falling star.
sighted object: a bright glowing object falling from the sky
witness description: A civilian observer who reported the sighting.
